definition: to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: She kept hundreds of copies of court verdicts, piled high, until her death.
sentences.chinese: 她保留了无数的法院裁定书，高束藏起，直至去逝。

sentences.english: Today we remember five interesting people who died this year.
sentences.chinese: 今天，我们向你介绍在今年去逝的五位有趣的美国人。

sentences.english: He first went home and sadly found that his mother passed away already.
sentences.chinese: 回到家乡，发现母亲已经去逝，悲恸不已。

sentences.english: He died four days later in a hospital. He was forty years old.
sentences.chinese: 他衣衫褴褛，他被送到医院四天后去逝，年仅40岁。

sentences.english: Zora's mother died in nineteen-oh-four, when Zora was thirteen years old.
sentences.chinese: 卓拉的母亲于1904年去逝，那时她还只有十三岁。

sentences.english: Her mother's death severely affected Zora's life.
sentences.chinese: 她母亲的去逝对她的生活产生了严重的影响。

sentences.english: But he got sick and he died after just a month in office.
sentences.chinese: 但他生病了，并在就职仅后一个月就去逝了。

sentences.english: She died in June of a heart attack at the age of eighty-six.
sentences.chinese: 今年6月，她因心脏病发作而去逝，享年86岁。

sentences.english: Her mother died of illness early with her father.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈因病去逝早，爸爸与她相依为命。

sentences.english: Oh, he died just several years before I was born.
sentences.chinese: 哦，我出生前几年他才去逝的。

sentences.english: He died with his daughter yet a school-girl.
sentences.chinese: 他去逝时，女儿还是个小学生。

definition: to leave one's mortal frame (idiom)/to die
to die/to depart this life (euphemism)/same as 去世
to die/to depart this mortal coil
lit. to fly on a crane to the Western Paradise/fig. to pass away (idiom)
